segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Katherine, and today we've got a very nerve-wracking situation for you.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们有一个非常紧张的情况要给你们。

segments.en: That's right.
We are going to meet the in-laws.
Meeting the in-laws.
So, who are in-laws?
These are the parents of your husband or wife.
segments.cn: 他们是你丈夫或妻子的父母。

segments.en: Right.
So, in this case, you have the mother-in-law and your father-in-law.
segments.cn: 所以，在这种情况下，你有岳母和岳父。

segments.en: That's right.
So, we're meeting these people for the very first time.
segments.cn: 所以，我们是第一次见这些人。

segments.en: You can imagine how nervous the man is, who's meeting his future wife's parents.
segments.cn: 你可以想象，那个见未来妻子父母的男人有多紧张。

segments.en: Let's learn all about what they talk about in today's dialogue.
segments.cn: 让我们来了解一下他们在今天的对话中谈论的内容。

segments.en: Mother, father, I'd like to introduce you to my fiancé, Bob.
segments.cn: 母亲，父亲，我想向你们介绍我的未婚夫Bob。

segments.en: Hello, Bob.
Welcome.
Thanks for having me.
Nice to meet the both of you.
I've heard so much.
So, Cindy told you about bringing home her last boyfriend then.
segments.cn: 所以，Cindy告诉你她上一个男朋友的事了。

segments.en: That idiot.
You're going to scare the poor boy.
Come in and have a drink.
Dinner will be on in just a bit.
What'll we be having?
Whiskey?
Bourbon?
Pick your poison.
If you have a lemonade, that'd be great.
segments.cn: 如果有柠檬水，那就太好了。

segments.en: Lemonade?
Sure, there's some in the fridge.
Mother makes her own lemonade from scratch.
segments.cn: 母亲自己从头做柠檬水。

segments.en: It's the best.
So, what are your hobbies, son?
segments.cn: 那么，你的爱好是什么，儿子？

segments.en: If you want, we can do some hunting tomorrow.
segments.cn: 如果你愿意，我们明天可以去打猎。

segments.en: I've just picked up a new rifle I've been meaning to try out.
segments.cn: 我刚买了一把新步枪，想试试。

segments.en: Should be a real hoot.
I'm not really... I don't really hunt.
You don't hunt?
Well, I'll beat them.
Bob is an animal rights activist.
He doesn't believe in harming animals.
Dinner's ready.
Let's go out to the patio where the pig is roasting.
segments.cn: 我们去露台，那里正在烤猪。

segments.en: Roast pig?
I'm a vegetarian.
All right, we're back.
So, a very awkward situation.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一个非常尴尬的情况。

segments.en: I think they might have a little bit of problems in the future.
segments.cn: 我觉得他们将来可能会有一些问题。

segments.en: Yeah, there are a lot of cultural differences between the characters, the son-in-law and the new parents.
segments.cn: 是的，角色之间，女婿和新父母之间有很多文化差异。

segments.en: The father-in-law.
So, it's really interesting.
Why don't we start off by looking at a couple of different words on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不先看看一些语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
So, first of all, we have the two characters, Cindy and Bob, who are getting married.
segments.cn: 首先，我们有两个角色，Cindy和Bob，他们要结婚。

segments.en: So, we call them... we call Bob Cindy's fiance.
segments.cn: 所以，我们称Bob为Cindy的未婚夫。

segments.en: Right.
So, my fiance.
And it comes from French, and it means to the person that you're going to get married to.
segments.cn: 这个词来自法语，意思是你将要结婚的人。

segments.en: That's right.
The person you've decided to get married to.
So, we say fiance.
We can say the same word for a man or a woman.
segments.cn: 对于男性或女性，我们都可以用同一个词。

segments.en: So, he is my fiance.
She is my fiance.
Okay.
My fiance.
Very good.
So, Cindy introduces her fiance, Bob, to her parents.
segments.cn: 所以，Cindy向她的父母介绍了她的未婚夫Bob。

segments.en: And they start talking a little bit.
And her dad, Thurston, invites him to go do some hunting tomorrow.
segments.cn: 她的父亲Thurston邀请他明天去打猎。

segments.en: That's right.
So, hunting is a sport in America and lots of places in the world where you shoot animals.
segments.cn: 所以，打猎在美国和世界许多地方是一项运动，猎杀动物。

segments.en: Okay.
So, you go in the woods, you wear brown and green colors, and you shoot animals to take them home and skin them and eat them.
segments.cn: 所以，你进入森林，穿上棕色和绿色的衣服，猎杀动物带回家，剥皮吃掉。

segments.en: Or to keep them as trophies.
All right.
So, you go hunting and, well, the way that you shoot these animals is you need to have a rifle.
segments.cn: 所以，你去打猎，而猎杀动物的方式是你需要有一把步枪。

segments.en: A rifle.
So, you could also call it a hunting rifle, in this case.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，你也可以称之为猎枪。

segments.en: A rifle is a gun, but it's a very long gun.
segments.cn: 步枪是一种枪，但它是一种非常长的枪。

segments.en: Right.
So, it's not a little gun that you just hold in your hand.
segments.cn: 所以，这不是你手持的小枪。

segments.en: It's very long.
It'll be maybe like half a meter long.
That's right.
And so, oftentimes, people, when they're hunting, they lie on the ground and they wait for the animals to pass, and they hide themselves, and then they shoot from a long distance.
segments.cn: 所以，通常人们在打猎时，会趴在地上，等待动物经过，藏起来，然后从远处射击。

segments.en: Right.
So, he's talking about hunting.
He's got a new rifle.
And he says, yeah, we should definitely go.
segments.cn: 他说，是的，我们一定要去。

segments.en: It should be a real hoot.
Should be a real hoot.
This is a very fun spoken English phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的口语表达。

segments.en: It's said more by older people than by younger people.
segments.cn: 这个说法更多是老年人使用，而不是年轻人。

segments.en: So, this is why the father says it in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以，这就是父亲在对话中说这句话的原因。

segments.en: A hoot should be a real good time.
segments.cn: 有趣应该是非常愉快的时光。

segments.en: Real fun.
A hoot.
So, how can you use this, like, oh, the party last night was a real hoot.
segments.cn: 所以，你怎么用这个，比如说，昨晚的派对真是太有趣了。

segments.en: Yep.
You can say that.
You can say, or she's a real hoot.
segments.cn: 你可以说，或者她真是个有趣的人。

segments.en: She's really funny.
Okay.
You know, she's really enjoyable.
segments.cn: 你知道，她真的很令人愉快。

segments.en: This is a little bit more, like, spoken and used by maybe older people, right?
segments.cn: 这有点像是更口语化的表达，可能是老年人用的，对吧？

segments.en: My mother would say this.
I wouldn't say this.
So, oh my goodness, it was a real hoot.
segments.cn: 所以，哦，我的天，真是太有趣了。

segments.en: Yeah.
All right.
So, he's talking about hunting, how much fun they would have, and unfortunately Bob is an animal rights activist.
segments.cn: 所以，他在谈论狩猎，他们会有多么有趣，不幸的是，鲍勃是个动物权利活动家。

segments.en: What does this mean?
So, an animal rights activist is someone who is very concerned with protecting the rights of animals.
segments.cn: 所以，动物权利活动家是非常关心保护动物权利的人。

segments.en: So, for example, if I'm an animal rights activist, maybe I will protest people who wear fur, or perhaps I will also try and secure land for a natural wildlife preserve so that animals can live in the wild.
segments.cn: 比如说，如果我是一名动物权利活动家，也许我会抗议穿毛皮的人，或者我还会试图为自然野生动物保护区争取土地，以便动物可以在野外生活。

segments.en: There's not houses or cars.
So, animal rights activists are people who try to make sure that animals are protected from human beings.
segments.cn: 所以，动物权利活动家是那些试图确保动物不受人类伤害的人。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
And this is what Bob is.
So, obviously, Bob is not really into hunting, right?
segments.cn: 所以，显然，鲍勃并不真的喜欢狩猎，对吧？

segments.en: I'm guessing, no.
These are two opposites.
You have people who like to kill animals and people who want to protect the lives of animals.
segments.cn: 有喜欢杀动物的人和想保护动物生命的人。

segments.en: Right.
Okay.
Well, and to finish off our language takeaway, dinner is ready.
segments.cn: 好吧，为了结束我们的语言学习，晚餐准备好了。

segments.en: So, let's go out to the patio.
Okay, a patio is a space outside the house, usually in the back, that's paved.
segments.cn: 好的，露台是房子外面的一个空间，通常在后面，是铺好的。

segments.en: So, there's like cement or bricks or some kind of tile, and that's where you have a table and chairs or some place to sit and rest.
segments.cn: 所以，有水泥、砖块或某种瓷砖，那里有桌子和椅子或一些地方可以坐下休息。

segments.en: This is where you have a grill.
So, it's an outdoor area, but it's not grass.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一个户外区域，但不是草地。

segments.en: Okay, so it's not your backyard.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这不是你的后院。

segments.en: Oh, it could be in your backyard.
The patio could be in the backyard.
That's right, but the ground in the patio is not grass.
segments.cn: 没错，但露台的地面不是草。

segments.en: It's some kind of material like cement or brick or wood.
segments.cn: 它是某种材料，比如水泥、砖或木头。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
So, great words there.
segments.cn: 所以，这里有很好的词汇。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to the dialogue again and we'll be back in a bit with Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍对话，然后稍后回来进行流利度训练。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
All right, we're back.
So, we have three great phrases here on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 所以，我们在流利度训练中有三个很好的短语。

segments.en: Why don't we start off with the first one.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不从第一个开始。

segments.en: So, the first one, we have to go back to the very beginning of this dialogue and think about these people who are introducing each other for the very first time.
segments.cn: 所以，第一个，我们必须回到这个对话的最开始，想想这些人第一次互相介绍。

segments.en: Cindy says, I want to introduce you to my fiancé, Bob.
segments.cn: 辛迪说，我想介绍你认识我的未婚夫鲍勃。

segments.en: Bob says to Cindy's parents, I've heard so much.
segments.cn: 鲍勃对辛迪的父母说，我听说过很多。

segments.en: I've heard so much.
Okay, so this phrase, you can usually use it when you meet somebody for the first time.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这个短语通常在你第一次见到某人时使用。

segments.en: I've heard so much about you.
segments.cn: 我听说过很多关于你的事。

segments.en: That's right.
So, the longer version is, I've heard so much about you.
segments.cn: 所以，较长的版本是，我听说过很多关于你的事。

segments.en: Basically, you're saying, listen, Cindy talks about you a lot.
segments.cn: 基本上，你是在说，听着，辛迪经常提到你。

segments.en: I've heard really nice things.
Sometimes people like to joke.
You say, I've heard so much about you.
segments.cn: 你说，我听说过很多关于你的事。

segments.en: They say, I hope only good things.
segments.cn: 他们说，我希望只有好事。

segments.en: Yeah, I hope not too much.
I hope not too much.
So, this is a very polite way to respond when someone introduces themselves.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一个非常礼貌的回应方式，当有人自我介绍时。

segments.en: Okay, I've heard so much about you.
segments.cn: 好的，我听说过很多关于你的事。

segments.en: It's a pleasure to finally meet you.
Exactly.
Okay, so they started talking and actually Thurston offers him a drink.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他们开始交谈，实际上瑟斯顿给他提供了一杯饮料。

segments.en: He says, well, what do you want?
Whiskey, bourbon, pick your poison.
All right, this is one of my very favorite phrases in English.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是我最喜欢的英语短语之一。

segments.en: The father-in-law wants to give the new son-in-law a drink and there are many different options.
segments.cn: 岳父想给新女婿一杯饮料，有很多不同的选择。

segments.en: So, pick your poison means pick your drink.
segments.cn: 所以，pick your poison 意思是选择你的饮料。

segments.en: You might hear this at a bar.
segments.cn: 你可能在酒吧听到这个。

segments.en: What do you want to drink?
Pick your poison.
You could have whiskey, rum.
segments.cn: 你可以喝威士忌、朗姆酒。

segments.en: So, usually we're just talking about alcoholic drinks.
segments.cn: 所以，通常我们只是在谈论酒精饮料。

segments.en: Okay, so you wouldn't really use this for juices or water.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你不会真的用这个来形容果汁或水。

segments.en: This is for alcohol.
Okay, so if you say pick your poison, that's for alcohol, right?
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你说选择你的毒药，那是指酒精，对吧？

segments.en: Or maybe you can ask somebody what they're drinking.
segments.cn: 或者你可以问某人他们在喝什么。

segments.en: You would say, what's your poison?
segments.cn: 你可以说，你的毒药是什么？

segments.en: Yeah, what's your poison?
Okay, so poison in this case is a slang term for alcohol.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在这种情况下，毒药是酒精的俚语。

segments.en: Very good.
And finally, when Cindy was talking about lemonade that her mother makes, she said she makes it from scratch.
segments.cn: 最后，当辛迪谈到她母亲做的柠檬水时，她说她是从零开始做的。

segments.en: To make something from scratch.
You could say, my mother makes chocolate chip cookies from scratch.
segments.cn: 你可以说，我妈妈从零开始做巧克力曲奇。

segments.en: This means not to buy something in the store but to make it all yourself from nothing.
segments.cn: 这意味着不是在商店买的，而是从头开始自己做。

segments.en: So making lemonade from scratch means taking lemons, cutting them, taking the juice, adding some sugar, so you're making it from nothing.
segments.cn: 所以，从零开始做柠檬水意味着拿柠檬，切开，榨汁，加一些糖，所以你是从零开始做的。

segments.en: You're not using some kind of kit or some kind of, you know, canned drink from the store.
segments.cn: 你没有使用某种套件或商店里的罐装饮料。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, maybe some Italians in Italy make their spaghetti from scratch with flour and they knead it and they make everything from scratch.
segments.cn: 好的，比如说，可能一些意大利人在意大利用面粉从零开始做意大利面，他们揉面，完全从零开始做。

segments.en: Wow, so you don't buy a box of spaghetti but you actually have to cut the spaghetti and pull it.
segments.cn: 哇，所以你不是买一盒意大利面，而是你实际上要切意大利面和拉面。

segments.en: Exactly.
Very, very hard work.
So to make something from scratch.
segments.cn: 所以，从零开始做某样东西。

segments.en: And usually you can add the something goes in between, right?
segments.cn: 通常你可以在中间加上某样东西，对吧？

segments.en: To make lemonade from scratch, make bread from scratch, make ice cream from scratch.
segments.cn: 从零开始做柠檬水，从零开始做面包，从零开始做冰淇淋。

segments.en: Okay, so those are our three phrases for today.
segments.cn: 好的，所以今天的三个短语就是这些。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue for one last time and we'll be back to talk about this very, very interesting topic.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一遍对话，然后我们会回来讨论这个非常有趣的话题。

segments.en: Mother, father, I'd like to introduce you to my fiancé Bob.
segments.cn: 母亲，父亲，我想介绍你们认识我的未婚夫鲍勃。

segments.en: Hello, Bob.
Welcome.
Thanks for having me.
Nice to meet the both of you.
I've heard so much.
So Cindy told you about bringing home her last boyfriend then.
segments.cn: 所以辛迪告诉你她上一个男朋友的事了。

segments.en: That idiot.
You're going to scare the poor boy.
Come in and have a drink.
Dinner will be on in just a bit.
What will you be having?
Whiskey?
Bourbon?
Pick your poison.
If you have a lemonade, that'd be great.
segments.cn: 如果有柠檬水，那就太好了。

segments.en: Sure, there's some in the fridge.
Mother makes her own lemonade from scratch.
segments.cn: 妈妈从头开始做她的柠檬水。

segments.en: It's the best.
So what are your hobbies, son?
segments.cn: 那么你的爱好是什么，儿子？

segments.en: If you want, we can do some hunting tomorrow.
segments.cn: 如果你愿意，我们明天可以去打猎。

segments.en: I've just picked up a new rifle I've been meaning to try out.
segments.cn: 我刚买了一把新步枪，想试试。

segments.en: Should be a real hoot.
Um, I, I'm not really, uh, I don't really hunt.
segments.cn: 嗯，我，我其实不太，呃，我不太打猎。

segments.en: You don't hunt?
Well, I'll be damned.
Bob is an animal rights activist.
segments.cn: 鲍勃是动物权利活动家。

segments.en: He doesn't believe in harming animals.
Dinner's ready.
Let's go out to the patio where the pig is roasting.
segments.cn: 我们去露台，那里正在烤猪。

segments.en: Roast pig?
I'm a vegetarian.
This is a very scary topic for a lot of people.
segments.cn: 这个话题对很多人来说很可怕。

segments.en: I think they get very nervous introducing themselves because in this case, Bob is going to be marrying Cindy.
segments.cn: 我觉得他们在自我介绍时会很紧张，因为在这种情况下，鲍勃将要娶辛迪。

segments.en: So these are going to be his in-laws forever.
segments.cn: 所以这些将永远是他的岳父岳母。

segments.en: Yeah, and it seems interesting the differences, as you mentioned before, between the father-in-law who's very much into hunting and drinks and likes roast pig.
segments.cn: 是的，正如你之前提到的，岳父非常喜欢打猎、喝酒和烤猪，而这个家伙更像是动物权利活动家，不喝酒。

segments.en: Whereas this guy is more of an animal rights activist, doesn't drink.
He's a vegetarian.
He doesn't eat meat.
segments.cn: 所以我觉得这会很复杂。

segments.en: So it's, I think it would be very complicated.
segments.cn: 我认为这在不同文化的人之间也很常见，对吧？

segments.en: And I think this happens a lot also with people from different cultures, right?
segments.cn: 也许你是亚洲人，而你要嫁给一个美国人或类似的情况。

segments.en: Maybe you're Asian and you're marrying an American or something like this.
Yeah, that's right.
segments.cn: 我觉得这可能会非常困难。

segments.en: I think it can be very, very difficult.
segments.cn: 我最近参加了一个中国女孩和美国男孩的婚礼，看到这些人聚在一起真是太棒了，因为家庭差异很大。

segments.en: I recently went to a wedding between a Chinese girl and an American guy, and it was amazing to see all these people getting together because the families were so different.
It was really fun.
They were all very supportive.
They were just excited for their kids.
segments.cn: 他们只是为自己的孩子感到兴奋。

segments.en: Yeah, but I think it can be a little bit difficult, right?
segments.cn: 是的，但我觉得这可能会有点困难，对吧？

segments.en: I mean, being in a family where the culture is so different or the traditions and the customs are strange to you.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，身处一个文化差异很大或传统和习俗对你来说很陌生的家庭。

segments.en: But it's exciting because then as a family, the young people who are getting married, they can pick the traditions they want and make new traditions.
segments.cn: 但这也很令人兴奋，因为作为一个家庭，年轻的新人可以选择他们想要的传统并创造新的传统。

segments.en: So this is a very interesting topic.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个非常有趣的话题。

segments.en: We want to know maybe if you are married, how did it go when you met your in-laws?
segments.cn: 我们想知道如果你已婚，当你见到岳父岳母时情况如何？

segments.en: Are you very different?
Or did you get along very well?
Or how is it in your country?
segments.cn: 或者在你们国家是怎样的？

segments.en: Yeah, please do let us know.
Our website is EnglishPod.com.
We hope to see you there.
All right, everyone.
Bye.
